result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony I Pena was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • : KNOWINGLY VIOLATING A HARASSMENT RESTRAINING ORDER, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT to sentence in case #22CF1086, with Huber privileges for work and treatment.

miscConds.notes: Full-time work/school (minimum of 40 hours of work per week).

Provide DNA sample by 2:00 pm on 9-07-2022.
Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Cash bond on deposit is to be applied; remainder to be returned to the poster.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

charges.descr: : KNOWINGLY VIOLATING A HARASSMENT RESTRAINING ORDER

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony I Pena

records.addlTxt: Missing record to be sealed.

Signed and Filed:  Order to Seal Proof of Treatment.
The original document was titled: Proof of Treatment
The original history event date is: 08-30-2022
Received and Filed:  Proposed Order to Seal Treatment Record.
Received and Filed:  Proposed Order to Seal a Court Record.

Defendant Anthony I Pena in court.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Anthony I Pena.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Court grants Defense's motion to seal treatment record. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional statement made by Kaylen V. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to sentence in case #22CF1086, with Huber privileges for work and treatment.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 YEAR. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- No contact with KTV. 
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 40 hours of work per week).
- Provide DNA sample by 2:00 pm on 9-07-2022.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Cash bond on deposit is to be applied; remainder to be returned to the poster.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Anthony I Pena in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Anthony I Pena in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony I Pena appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed due to 22CF1086 (same victim).  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE to follow 22CF1086.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
